predictions.text: Alphabet (Google) will complete at least $30.0 billion (USD) in aggregate gross bond issuance (one or multiple offerings) by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if Alphabet/Google (or underwriter syndicate) confirms completed bond issuance totaling >=$30.0B via press release, offering documents, or SEC filings (e.g., 8-K, 10-Q, prospectus supplement) dated on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: SEC EDGAR: Alphabet 8-K/10-Q updates; prospectus supplements for debt offerings
Dealogic/Bloomberg new issue logs for GOOG/GOOGL
Underwriter press releases confirming pricing and size
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting indicates the deal size is already >$30B; the remaining uncertainty is completion/settlement and official confirmation before month-end.

predictions.text: The U.S. EPA will publish in the Federal Register a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (or equivalent formal proposal) to rescind, revise, or otherwise nullify the 2009 greenhouse-gas “endangerment finding” by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if a Federal Register posting (proposed rule/NPRM) explicitly proposes rescinding or revising the EPA endangerment finding and is published on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Federal Register docket for EPA air/climate rules
EPA regulatory agenda updates (Unified Agenda)
OMB/OIRA “reginfo.gov” entries for GHG endangerment-related actions
predictions.rationale: Public signaling suggests intent; the key gating steps are interagency review and drafting a legally defensible NPRM.

predictions.text: At least 15 U.S. states (state AGs and/or governors), in a single action or multiple actions collectively, will file suit challenging EPA’s attempt to rescind/revise the greenhouse-gas endangerment finding by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if court filings and/or state AG press releases show >=15 states as plaintiffs/petitioners in litigation challenging an EPA endangerment-finding rescission/revision effort (proposal or final action), filed on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: State AG press releases (CA, NY, MA, WA, etc.)
PACER / D.C. Circuit petitions for review
Environmental NGO litigation trackers (e.g., EELP, Sabin Center)
predictions.rationale: Endangerment is foundational to U.S. GHG regulation; multi-state litigation is a common, rapid response to major EPA reversals.

predictions.text: In at least one U.S. Census Bureau monthly retail sales release covering months between 2026-02 and 2026-08, seasonally adjusted retail sales excluding motor vehicles & parts dealers and gasoline stations will show a month-over-month decline of at least 0.6% (m/m) by 2026-09-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if any Advance Monthly Sales for Retail and Food Services release (published on/before the deadline) shows SA retail sales excluding NAICS 441 and 447 down <= -0.6% m/m for a month from Feb–Aug 2026 (using the initially published figure, not later revisions).
monitoring_signals: Census ‘Advance Monthly Sales for Retail and Food Services’ tables
High-frequency card spending nowcasts (JPM, BofA, etc.)
Consumer sentiment and real disposable income trends
predictions.rationale: Softening demand and consumer strain raise odds of at least one sharp monthly pullback within the next two quarters.

predictions.text: The New York Fed will report a credit-card serious delinquency rate (90+ days past due) at or above 12.0% in at least one Quarterly Report on Household Debt and Credit released by 2026-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if any NY Fed Quarterly Report on Household Debt and Credit released on/before the deadline shows the credit-card 90+ DPD delinquency measure (serious delinquency rate) >=12.0% for the referenced quarter.
monitoring_signals: NY Fed Household Debt and Credit releases and underlying data
Bank earnings disclosures: card charge-offs and delinquencies
Consumer credit conditions (Senior Loan Officer Opinion Survey)
predictions.rationale: Balances are high and credit is normalizing; however, continued employment strength could keep delinquencies below prior-cycle peaks.

predictions.text: China’s National Bureau of Statistics will report year-over-year CPI inflation at or below -0.2% in at least one monthly release by 2026-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if an official NBS monthly CPI release (or an NBS CPI table reproduced by a major financial newswire) shows headline CPI y/y <= -0.2% for any month, with the release occurring on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: NBS CPI/PPI monthly releases
China producer-price and property-sector indicators
Policy easing measures and credit impulse
predictions.rationale: Weak domestic demand and persistent PPI deflation increase deflation-tail risk, but food/energy volatility can prevent headline CPI from turning negative.

predictions.text: Hong Kong’s monetary/financial authorities (e.g., HKMA/SFC, depending on final framework) will publicly announce the granting of at least one license/authorization to issue a fiat-referenced stablecoin under Hong Kong’s new stablecoin licensing regime by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if HKMA/SFC (or the designated licensing authority) posts a press release, register entry, or gazette notice stating that at least one entity has been granted a stablecoin issuer license/authorization under the new regime on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: HKMA/SFC policy statements and licensing registers
Consultation conclusions and effective-date announcements
Major applicants’ corporate announcements (banks/fintechs)
predictions.rationale: Momentum toward a regulated stablecoin hub is strong, but legal commencement dates and supervisory readiness could push first licenses beyond 2026.

predictions.text: Strategy (formerly MicroStrategy) will announce and/or file with the SEC for a new debt financing (convertible notes, senior notes, or secured debt) with stated gross proceeds of at least $1.0 billion (USD) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if Strategy issues a press release and/or files an 8-K/prospectus supplement describing a debt offering with announced aggregate principal amount (or expected gross proceeds) >=$1.0B on/before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: Strategy press releases and SEC filings (8-K, prospectus supplements)
Convertible-note market activity and implied vol levels
Bitcoin price drawdowns and collateral/loan-to-value dynamics
predictions.rationale: Leverage/refinancing incentives rise in volatile crypto cycles, but capital-market windows and BTC price action will determine timing.

predictions.text: The U.S. FDA will grant a 510(k) clearance or De Novo authorization for at least one AI/ML-enabled device with an indication explicitly involving triage/notification for an acute intracranial condition using brain MRI (not CT) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Count as YES if the FDA device database (510(k) or De Novo) lists a cleared/authorized product on/before the deadline whose indication statement explicitly references brain MRI and triage/notification for an acute intracranial abnormality (e.g., stroke/hemorrhage).
monitoring_signals: FDA 510(k)/De Novo databases; Digital Health updates
Company regulatory announcements from neuroimaging AI vendors
Peer-reviewed validation studies and multicenter trial readouts
predictions.rationale: Clinical promise is clear, but MRI workflow integration and evidence thresholds make 2026 authorization uncertain.
